verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> it came <S%G1096><s%> about that while <S%G1722><s%> the multitude <S%G3793><s%> were pressing <S%G1945><s%> around <S%G1945><s%> Him and listening <S%G191><s%> to the word <S%G3056><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> He was standing <S%G2476><s%> by the lake <S%G3041><s%> of Gennesaret; <S%G1082><s%>

and He saw <S%G3708><s%> two <S%G1417><s%> boats <S%G4142><s%> lying <S%G2476><s%> at the edge of the lake; <S%G3041><s%> but the fishermen <S%G231><s%> had gotten <S%G576><s%> out of them, and were washing <S%G4150><s%> their nets. <S%G1350><s%>

And He got <S%G1684><s%> into one <S%G1520><s%> of the boats, <S%G4143><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> was Simon's, and asked <S%G2065><s%> him to put <S%G1877><s%> out a little <S%G3641><s%> way <S%G3641><s%> from the land. <S%G1093><s%> And He sat <S%G2523><s%> down <S%G2523><s%> and [began] teaching <S%G1321><s%> the multitudes <S%G3793><s%> from the boat. <S%G4143><s%>

And when <S%G5613><s%> He had finished <S%G3973><s%> speaking, <S%G2980><s%> He said <S%G3004><s%> to Simon, <S%G4613><s%> "Put <S%G1877><s%> out into the deep <S%G899><s%> water <S%G899><s%> and let <S%G5465><s%> down <S%G5465><s%> your nets <S%G1350><s%> for a catch. <S%G61><s%>"

And Simon <S%G4613><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> and said, <S%G3004><s%> "Master, <S%G1988><s%> we worked <S%G2872><s%> hard <S%G2872><s%> all <S%G3650><s%> night <S%G3571><s%> and caught <S%G2983><s%> nothing, <S%G3762><s%> but at Your bidding <S%G4487><s%> I will let <S%G5465><s%> down <S%G5465><s%> the nets. <S%G1350><s%>"

And when they had done <S%G4160><s%> this, <S%G3778><s%> they enclosed <S%G4788><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> quantity <S%G4128><s%> of fish; <S%G2486><s%> and their nets <S%G1350><s%> [began] to break; <S%G1284><s%>

and they signaled <S%G2656><s%> to their partners <S%G3353><s%> in the other <S%G2087><s%> boat, <S%G4143><s%> for them to come <S%G2064><s%> and help <S%G4815><s%> them. And they came, <S%G2064><s%> and filled <S%G4092><s%> both <S%G297><s%> of the boats, <S%G4143><s%> so <S%G5620><s%> that they began to sink. <S%G1036><s%>

But when Simon <S%G4613><s%> Peter <S%G4074><s%> saw <S%G3708><s%> [that,] he fell <S%G4363><s%> down <S%G4363><s%> at Jesus' feet, <S%G1119><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Depart <S%G1831><s%> from me, for I am <S%G1510><s%> a sinful <S%G268><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> O Lord! <S%G2962><s%>"

For amazement <S%G2285><s%> had seized <S%G4023><s%> him and all <S%G3956><s%> his companions <S%G3588><s%> <S%G4862><s%> because <S%G1909><s%> of the catch <S%G61><s%> of fish <S%G2486><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> they had taken; <S%G4815><s%>

and so <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> James <S%G2385><s%> and John, <S%G2491><s%> sons <S%G5207><s%> of Zebedee, <S%G2199><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> were partners <S%G2844><s%> with Simon. <S%G4613><s%> And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to Simon, <S%G4613><s%> "Do not fear, <S%G5399><s%> from now <S%G3568><s%> on you will be catching <S%G2221><s%> men. <S%G444><s%>"
And when they had brought <S%G2609><s%> their boats <S%G4143><s%> to land, <S%G1093><s%> they left <S%G863><s%> everything <S%G3956><s%> and followed <S%G190><s%> Him.

And it came <S%G1096><s%> about that while <S%G1722><s%> He was in one <S%G1520><s%> of the cities, <S%G4172><s%> behold, <S%G2400><s%> [there was] a man <S%G435><s%> full <S%G4134><s%> of leprosy; <S%G3014><s%> and when he saw <S%G3708><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> he fell <S%G4098><s%> on his face <S%G4383><s%> and implored <S%G1189><s%> Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Lord, <S%G2962><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> You are willing, <S%G2309><s%> You can <S%G1410><s%> make <S%G2511><s%> me clean. <S%G2511><s%>"

And He stretched <S%G1614><s%> out His hand, <S%G5495><s%> and touched <S%G681><s%> him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "I am <S%G2309><s%> willing; <S%G2309><s%> be cleansed. <S%G2511><s%>" And immediately <S%G2112><s%> the leprosy <S%G3014><s%> left <S%G565><s%> him.

And He ordered <S%G3853><s%> him to tell <S%G3004><s%> no <S%G3367><s%> one, <S%G3367><s%> "But go <S%G565><s%> and show <S%G1166><s%> yourself <S%G4572><s%> to the priest, <S%G2409><s%> and make <S%G4374><s%> an offering <S%G4374><s%> for your cleansing, <S%G2512><s%> just <S%G2531><s%> as Moses <S%G3475><s%> commanded, <S%G4367><s%> for a testimony <S%G3142><s%> to them."

But the news <S%G3056><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> Him was spreading <S%G1330><s%> even <S%G3123><s%> farther, <S%G3123><s%> and great <S%G4183><s%> multitudes <S%G3793><s%> were gathering <S%G4905><s%> to hear <S%G191><s%> [Him] and to be healed <S%G2323><s%> of their sicknesses. <S%G769><s%>
But He Himself <S%G846><s%> would [often] slip <S%G5298><s%> away <S%G5298><s%> to the wilderness <S%G2048><s%> and pray. <S%G4336><s%>

And it came <S%G1096><s%> about one <S%G1520><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> that He was teaching; <S%G1321><s%> and there were [some] Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and teachers <S%G3547><s%> of the law <S%G3547><s%> sitting <S%G2521><s%> [there,] who <S%G3739><s%> had come <S%G2064><s%> from every <S%G3956><s%> village <S%G2968><s%> of Galilee <S%G1056><s%> and Judea <S%G2453><s%> and [from] Jerusalem; <S%G2419><s%> and the power <S%G1411><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> was [present] for Him to perform <S%G2390><s%> healing. <S%G2390><s%>

And behold, <S%G2400><s%> [some] men <S%G435><s%> [were] carrying <S%G5342><s%> on a bed <S%G2825><s%> a man <S%G444><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> was paralyzed; <S%G3886><s%> and they were trying <S%G2212><s%> to bring <S%G1533><s%> him in, and to set <S%G5087><s%> him down <S%G5087><s%> in front <S%G1799><s%> of Him.

And not finding <S%G2147><s%> any <S%G4169><s%> [way] to bring <S%G1533><s%> him in because <S%G1223><s%> of the crowd, <S%G3793><s%> they went <S%G305><s%> up on the roof <S%G1430><s%> and let <S%G2524><s%> him down <S%G2524><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> the tiles <S%G2766><s%> with his stretcher, <S%G2826><s%> right in the center, <S%G3319><s%> in front <S%G1715><s%> of Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>
And seeing <S%G3708><s%> their faith, <S%G4102><s%> He said, <S%G3004><s%> "Friend, <S%G444><s%> your sins <S%G266><s%> are forgiven <S%G863><s%> you."

And the scribes <S%G1122><s%> and the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> began <S%G757><s%> to reason, <S%G1260><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Who <S%G5101><s%> is this <S%G3778><s%> [man] who <S%G3739><s%> speaks <S%G2980><s%> blasphemies <S%G988><s%>? Who <S%G5101><s%> can <S%G1410><s%> forgive <S%G863><s%> sins, <S%G266><s%> but God <S%G2316><s%> alone <S%G3441><s%>?"

But Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> aware <S%G1921><s%> of their reasonings, <S%G1261><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Why <S%G5101><s%> are you reasoning <S%G1260><s%> in your hearts <S%G2588><s%>?

"Which <S%G5101><s%> is easier, <S%G2123><s%> to say, <S%G3004><s%> 'Your sins <S%G266><s%> have been forgiven <S%G863><s%> you,' or <S%G2228><s%> to say, <S%G3004><s%> 'Rise <S%G1453><s%> and walk <S%G4043><s%>'?

"But in order <S%G2443><s%> that you may know <S%G3609><s%> that the Son <S%G5207><s%> of Man <S%G444><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> on earth <S%G1093><s%> to forgive <S%G863><s%> sins, <S%G266><s%>" – He said <S%G3004><s%> to the paralytic <S%G3886><s%> – "I say <S%G3004><s%> to you, rise, <S%G1453><s%> and take <S%G142><s%> up your stretcher <S%G2826><s%> and go <S%G4198><s%> home. <S%G3624><s%>"

And at once <S%G3916><s%> he rose <S%G450><s%> up before <S%G1799><s%> them, and took <S%G142><s%> up what <S%G3739><s%> he had been lying <S%G2621><s%> on, and went <S%G565><s%> home, <S%G3624><s%> glorifying <S%G1392><s%> God. <S%G2316><s%>

And they were all <S%G537><s%> seized <S%G2983><s%> with astonishment <S%G1611><s%> and [began] glorifying <S%G1392><s%> God; <S%G2316><s%> and they were filled <S%G4092><s%> with fear, <S%G5401><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "We have seen <S%G3708><s%> remarkable <S%G3861><s%> things <S%G3861><s%> today. <S%G4594><s%>"

And after <S%G3326><s%> that He went <S%G1831><s%> out, and noticed <S%G2300><s%> a tax-gatherer <S%G5058><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Levi, <S%G3017><s%> sitting <S%G2521><s%> in the tax office, <S%G5058><s%> and He said <S%G3004><s%> to him, "Follow <S%G190><s%> Me."
And he left <S%G2641><s%> everything <S%G3956><s%> behind, <S%G2641><s%> and rose <S%G450><s%> and [began] to follow <S%G190><s%> Him.

And Levi <S%G3017><s%> gave <S%G4160><s%> a big <S%G3173><s%> reception <S%G1403><s%> for Him in his house; <S%G3614><s%> and there was a great <S%G4183><s%> crowd <S%G3793><s%> of tax-gatherers and other <S%G243><s%> [people] who <S%G3739><s%> were reclining <S%G2621><s%> [at the table] with them.

And the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and their scribes <S%G1122><s%> [began] grumbling <S%G1111><s%> at His disciples, <S%G3101><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Why <S%G1223><s%> <S%G5101><s%> do you eat <S%G2068><s%> and drink <S%G4095><s%> with the tax-gatherers and sinners <S%G268><s%>?"

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "[It is] not those <S%G3588><s%> who are well <S%G5198><s%> who need <S%G5532><s%> a physician, <S%G2395><s%> but those <S%G3588><s%> who are sick. <S%G2560><s%>
"I have not come <S%G2064><s%> to call <S%G2564><s%> the righteous <S%G1342><s%> but sinners <S%G268><s%> to repentance. <S%G3341><s%>"

And they said <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "The disciples <S%G3101><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%> often <S%G4437><s%> fast <S%G3522><s%> and offer <S%G4160><s%> prayers; <S%G1162><s%> the [disciples] of the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> do the same; <S%G3668><s%> but Yours <S%G4674><s%> eat <S%G2068><s%> and drink. <S%G4095><s%>"

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "You cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3361><s%> make <S%G4160><s%> the attendants <S%G5207><s%> of the bridegroom <S%G3567><s%> fast <S%G3522><s%> while <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3739><s%> the bridegroom <S%G3566><s%> is with them, can you?

"But [the] days <S%G2250><s%> will come; <S%G2064><s%> and when <S%G3752><s%> the bridegroom <S%G3566><s%> is taken <S%G522><s%> away <S%G522><s%> from them, then <S%G5119><s%> they will fast <S%G3522><s%> in those <S%G1565><s%> days. <S%G2250><s%>"

And He was also <S%G2532><s%> telling <S%G3004><s%> them a parable: <S%G3850><s%> "No <S%G3762><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> tears <S%G4977><s%> a piece <S%G1915><s%> from a new <S%G2537><s%> garment <S%G2440><s%> and puts <S%G1911><s%> it on an old <S%G3820><s%> garment; <S%G2440><s%> otherwise <S%G7507><s%> he will both <S%G2532><s%> tear <S%G4977><s%> the new, <S%G2537><s%> and the piece <S%G1915><s%> from the new <S%G2537><s%> will not match <S%G4856><s%> the old. <S%G3820><s%>

"And no <S%G3762><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> puts <S%G906><s%> new <S%G3501><s%> wine <S%G3631><s%> into old <S%G3820><s%> wineskins; <S%G779><s%> otherwise <S%G7507><s%> the new <S%G3501><s%> wine <S%G3631><s%> will burst <S%G4486><s%> the skins, <S%G779><s%> and it will be spilled <S%G7062><s%> out, and the skins <S%G779><s%> will be ruined. <S%G622><s%>
"But new <S%G3501><s%> wine <S%G3631><s%> must <S%G992><s%> be put <S%G992><s%> into fresh <S%G2537><s%> wineskins. <S%G779><s%>

"And no <S%G3762><s%> one, <S%G3762><s%> after drinking <S%G4095><s%> old <S%G3820><s%> [wine] wishes <S%G2309><s%> for new; <S%G3501><s%> for he says, <S%G3004><s%> 'The old <S%G3820><s%> is good <S%G5543><s%> [enough.]'"
